text: Emidio "Mimi" Soltysik (October 30, 1974 â€“ June 28, 2020) was an American socialist political activist. He was a member of the Socialist Party USA. He was the party's nominee for president of the United States in the 2016 election alongside Angela Nicole Walker, who was the party's vice-presidential nominee. Soltysik was born in Reading, Pennsylvania. He died of liver cancer on June 28, 2020, at the age of 45. ==References== Category:1974 births Category:2020 deaths Category:2016 United States presidential candidates Category:American political activists Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Politicians from Pennsylvania Category:Socialists
title: Mimi Soltysik
